title: Sri Lanka could get up to US$6bn from India, talks with Japan: Coomaraswamy
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka could get as much as 6.0 billion dollars in “bridge financing” from India and talks are underway with Japan to also get funds, ex-Central Bank Governor Indrajit Coomaraswamy who is an advisor to the government said.
“India has agreed to give 4.5 billion dollars,” Coomaraswamy told an online forum organized by the central bank.
India had agreed to provide 500 million US dollars for fuel, and another billion US dollars for essential goods.
About 3.0 billion US dollars is expected through deferred payments under the Asian Clearing Union to India.
Officials have said another 500 million US dollars are also under discussion for fuel.
India has also sounded out Japan over funding for Sri Lanka during a meeting of Quad nations recently, Coomaraswamy said.
There were some indications that Japan may provide some money, he said.
China fears Sri Lanka swap re-structuring if proceeds are used: Coomaraswamy

Sri Lanka has drawn down a 1.5 billion US dollar equivalent swap from the Peoples’s Bank of China which cannot be used. China fears it will be forced to re-structure the swap if conditions were allowed to be used.
Agencies like the World Bank and Asian Development Bank cannot give new loans because Sri Lanka’s debt is unsustainable. At the moment the agencies are repurposing loans.

There is a strong possibility that staff level agreement could be reached with the IMF in 4 to 5 weeks but a drawdown could take longer as progress must be shown in debt restructuring. (Colombo/June02/2022)
